I have tried safe mode with no plugins and still exactly as above. I have tried turning Advanced Protection off and again no change. The attached screenshot is an example of the problem.

If I access the emails using Safari then I have no issue.

Hello,

Just recently there has been issues with how a job search at Glassdoor.com is appearing via my Firefox browser. It seems that the formatting is all messed up, and everything gets shoved to the left margin, and there is no scroll bar. (See first image)

If I reduce the size of the zoom level, I can see the search results actually have appeared, but they are shoved even further to the left margin and no scroll bar again. (See second image)

This only happens with anything connected with a job search at Glassdoor.com. Salary search, company search, etc are all fine, just the job search, which is really inconvenient since I am actively looking for a job.

I've attached images of this for you.

The job search pages work fine in Chrome. Please don't make me use Chrome.

Thank you,

Sheri

title: Firefox Addon : Java Script for Hardware Token based authentication
content:
Hi,

I am trying to configure PKI based authentication and encryption system in my organization using Hardware token. I was able to install my hardware token feitan ePass2003 Auto in privacy->security device. I am able to see my certificates under view certificate after entering my password for private key. After research on internet, came to know that Applet based client authentication is obsolete and hence i have configure my token in Firefox. The next step i.e Authentication page is where i have got stuck up. Can any one please give details guide on how to use cryptoken operation(challenge & signing) and access to token in JavaScript at client side login page. I could not get hold of any library of java script for access to token through Firefox. Any guidance is highly appreciated.

Thanks

Mitz

title: Why does not Firefox supports Touch Bar completely?
content:
Hi, I always use Firefox.

I wonder why Microsoft Edge which was born later than Firefox supports Touch Bar completely, on the other hand Firefox which was born so long before Edge doesn't support Touch Bar completely?

TouchBar on Firefox show static buttons only. It's so stupid, I think.

The features of Media Scrubber and going to registered site on top sites can be only operated on Touch Bar, but going to previous/forward page, opening new tab, and reloading page is also available on keyboard shortcut.

I think it is meaningless that supports only these features that can be operated by keyboard. It is worth supporting features that can be only operated by TouchBar such as Media Scrubber.


I want Mozilla to support these feature of Touch Bar like Media Scrubber completely because I love Firefox.
creator: b1815351

title: Firefox preventing computer from sleeping - powercfg showing audio playing when no audio playing
content:
Hello,

I love Firefox. Thanks for making it and please keep up the good work. I used Firefox for years, switched to Chrome for about 10 and have now come back to Firefox again. Love the browser.tabs.unloadOnLowMemory config option. This was crucial to me returning to Firefox and I suggest you make this the default.

Anyway...

The issue I'm writing this for is that Firefox seems to be preventing my computer from sleeping. When I run

powercfg /requests

from a command prompt run as administrator, I get the following info: SYSTEM: [DRIVER] Realtek High Definition Audio (HDAUDIO\FUNC_01&VEN_10EC&DEV_0255&SUBSYS_10251259&REV_1000\5&26841d0a&0&00) An audio stream is currently in use. [PROCESS] \Device\HarddiskVolume9\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe [PROCESS] \Device\HarddiskVolume9\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe [PROCESS] \Device\HarddiskVolume9\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe [PROCESS] \Device\HarddiskVolume9\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe [PROCESS] \Device\HarddiskVolume9\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe [PROCESS] \Device\HarddiskVolume9\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe [PROCESS] \Device\HarddiskVolume9\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe [PROCESS] \Device\HarddiskVolume9\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe [PROCESS] \Device\HarddiskVolume9\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe

This seems to show Firefox running audio that is preventing the computer from sleeping. However, none of the tabs are currently playing any audio. Thought I'd report the issue here.

title: LiveJournal
content:
Hi!

I'm representing LiveJournal and I'd like to clarify the recent security concerns.

We consider security our main priority and are constantly paying particular attention to it when developing new features and updating old ones. Within the past 8 years we have:

- switched to HTTPS for all pages; - improved password storage mechanics; - implemented suspicious activity detecting system which tracks and block suspicious logins; - maintained monitoring for vulnerabilities both within LiveJournal's code and third-party software employed by us; - recommended all of our users to update their passwords at least once per 6 months and to use different passwords for different services; - we have also disabled passwords that haven't been updated for several years.

You may find the details in official LJ new channel - https://news.livejournal.com/155859.html

We are keeping track of the information distributed in the Internet and want our users to feel safe. That’s why we kindly ask you to stop showing security alert to Firefox browser users about their LiveJournal accounts security.

Thank you.

title: img src url not resolving when it is a GET request to a jsp page
content:
I think this is a bug, but thought I'd ask here first.

On FireFox 76.0.1, Windows 10, 64 bit

This is not resolving (names changed for privacy)

The URL resolves correctly when used alone. Clicking View Image on the browser right mouse menu on the alt ('none') link also resolves correctly. According to the dev console Network tab, it's not even trying to access the specified URL, and hovering over it on the Inspector tab reports "Cannot load image"

The page containing that image definition works correctly in Chrome, Edge beta, and Opera.

Thanks! Dan

title: Send tab to devices not working from some iOS apps
content:
At one point this used to work, but it seems to have stopped working recently.

I use the Send to Device feature frequently, but certain share combos don't seem to work at all.

What works:

  • iOS Firefox to desktop
  • iOS Safari to desktop
  • iOS Edge to desktop
  • Some random iOS apps (IMDB, Amazon) to desktop
  • Desktop Firefox to iOS Firefox

What doesn't work:

  • iOS Twitter to desktop
  • iOS Facebook to desktop
  • iOS Reddit to desktop
  • iOS Google Chrome to desktop
  • iOS Yelp to desktop

I'm on Firefox 76.0.1 (Windows 10) and iOS 13.5.

title: My email address is in use by another Firefox account user?
content:
I just tried to add a secondary email address to my Firefox account and get an error message stating that this email address is in use by another Firefox account user (already verified by another user).

Is there a way of finding out which account it is registered to? I can't recall ever using this email address in Firefox before?

Thanks
creator: grant.prowse

title: Firefox won't open, nor will Firefox Profile Manager
content: I'm not sure what I can do to fix the problem; the answer I've found uses the Profile Manager and I can't access it, it'll open for a split second then close again.

title: impresion defectuosa(solo se permite la primera pagina)
content:
al ingresar a una plataforma de estudio (privativa) y al imprimir para guardar en pdf solo se muestra la primera pagina; quise dejar como impresora predetermianda fox it reader pero no me lo permitio el soft ware

¿alguna idea para corregir este inconvenietne?
creator: vince_campos

title: Deleting a URL in address bar
content:
I want to delete a URL in my address bar. I have followed the instructions on a Mozilla support page but that does not work.
These are the instructions I have followed:
Clearing a single item from the address bar history

To clear a single item in the address bar history, click the drop-down arrow in the address bar.

show history address bar 57

Press the ↓ down arrow key or move the mouse, to highlight the entry to delete.

To clear the highlighted item, hold down the Shift key and press Delete on your keyboard.

---
Nothing happens when I follow these instructions.
Can anyone help me?
Thanks very much.
creator: richsprt

title: Firefox is preventing Macbook to sleep
content:
Since I upgraded my macbook to Catalina, I found that my macbook can longer automatically go to sleep when the lid is open. And the culprit seems to be the firefox browser, because in the activity monitor, it always shows that firefox is preventing the sleep.

Is there any reason that firefox is preventing my laptop to sleep? And how can I turn it off.
creator: lajiyoujian25
